p.s: Galaxies are vast collections of stars in space .
They can be pretty awesome to look at , especially if you can see the structure of the galaxy .
Here 's five ways that you can find a galaxy in outer space .
The first three only work in the northern hemisphere , while the fourth only works in the southern hemisphere .

item.s: Find the constellation of Andromeda .
You should see three bright stars in a line , plus a bunch of dim stars .
Find the star Mirach .
It 's the middle star in the line of three bright stars .
Look slightly north and to the right of Mirach .
A star map will help you pin down the location .
The galaxy should appear as a fuzzy patch .
Find the Andromeda galaxy using the method above .
Go from the Andromeda galaxy to Mirach , then go the same distance again . the galaxy should look like a dimmer version of the Andromeda galaxy .
Go to a dark site .
M81 is very faint - it 's the dimmest galaxy that can be seen with the naked eye .
Find the Big Dipper .
This will point the way to the galaxy .
Go from Phecda ( bottom left of the trapezoid ) , through Dubhe ( top right of the trapezoid , used to find the pole star ) , then go the same distance again .
The galaxy should appear as a very faint fuzzy patch - if it 's dark enough , and if you have good eyesight .
A star map is very helpful .
Look south .
These galaxies are very bright - brighter than most stars .
You should see two large fuzzy sparkly patches . these are the Large Magellanic cloud ( LMC ) and the Small Magellanic cloud ( SMC ) .
If you want to be more precise , the SMC is in the constellations of Tucana and Hydrus , and the LMC is in Dorado and Mensa .
Get a telescope and a star map .
Other galaxies are only visible through a telescope , you ca n't see them with the naked eye .
Decide on a galaxy to look at .
For starters , you can try finding the galaxies already mentioned .
You 'll be able to make out details that you ca n't see with the naked eye .
I 'd also recommend M51 , the Whirlpool galaxy - a favourite among photographers .
Use the star map to find the co-ordinates of the galaxy .
You can also find them on the internet .
Point your telescope at the galaxy and take a look .
If you have a computerised mount , just enter the co-ordinates of the galaxy and it will find it by itself .
Keep trying .
Galaxies are very far away , and this makes them very dim and hard to find .
If you ca n't find it one night , try again tomorrow .
Never look at the sun .
If you 're hoping to see images like the amazing photos that you can find on the internet , you 're in for a shock .
Unless you buy a really powerful and expensive telescope , you wo n't see very much in the galaxies that you look at .
